generalInfo: Abacavir is present in breast milk. Breastfeeding is generally not recommended for HIV-positive mothers due to the risk of transmission.

hepaticImpairment.specificInfo: Avoid in moderate to severe hepatic impairment. In mild cases, dose adjustment may be considered.

generalInfo: Abacavir should only be used in pregnancy if the expected benefit justifies the potential risk. Mitochondrial dysfunction has been reported in infants exposed in utero.

renalImpairment.specificInfo: No dose adjustment is needed in renal impairment, but use in patient with end-stage renal disease is not recommended.

sideEffects.specificInfo: Common: Nausea, vomiting, diarrhoea, fatigue, headache, fever, rash (minor), insomnia, dizziness, abdominal pain. Rare: Lactic acidosis, pancreatitis. Frequency not known: Hypersensitivity reaction
